column1: This document outlines the joint steps and timelines for both parties to reach an agreed partnership. Steps marked "Y" in the Client-Facing column are appropriate to share with the client. Steps marked "Y" in Forecast Milestone are tracked by the internal Ops team for financial forecasting.

column7: Not Started | In Progress | Complete | At Risk | Blocked

column11: Success Criteria / Notes
Meeting held; pain points documented; scope and goals understood by both parties. Identify key stakeholders, decision-making process, and internal timeline on client side.
Internal alignment complete; scoping notes summarized; any open questions flagged for follow-up with client.

column3: Build proposal with internal Ops team
column11: Proposal drafted covering scope, approach, pricing, and proposed timeline.
Proposal reviewed and approved internally. Pricing confirmed. Ready for client delivery.

column3: Present proposal to client (with internal Ops team)
column11: Proposal presented in full. Client questions addressed. Both parties agree on next steps. *** KEY FORECAST MILESTONE ***
All follow-up questions resolved. Client has full understanding of proposed scope and value.

column3: [TBD WITH CLIENT] Client shares proposal internally — map with client
column11: MAP WITH CLIENT: Who are the internal stakeholders that need to review? What is the internal sign-off process? What is a realistic timeline for internal review? Any known objections or concerns?

column3: [TBD WITH CLIENT] Client internal stakeholder review & alignment
column11: All key internal stakeholders have reviewed the proposal. Champion has internal alignment to move forward.
Status confirmed. Any blockers or concerns surfaced and addressed. Next steps agreed upon.

column3: [TBD WITH CLIENT] Client provides verbal approval to proceed with formal SOW — map with client
column11: Verbal confirmation received that client wants to proceed to SOW. MAP WITH CLIENT: Who is the internal decision-maker? What does formal approval look like? Any additional approvals required (budget, legal, procurement)? *** KEY FORECAST MILESTONE ***
SOW drafted with full scope, deliverables, acceptance criteria, timelines, payment terms, and pricing.
Resource plan completed. Delivery team tentatively identified. Capacity confirmed for proposed start date.
SOW reviewed and approved internally. All commercial and legal terms signed off. Ready for client delivery.
SOW delivered to client. Receipt confirmed. Client understands review timeline expectation. *** KEY FORECAST MILESTONE ***

column3: [TBD WITH CLIENT] Client SOW review — map with client
column11: MAP WITH CLIENT: Who will review the SOW? Is procurement involved? What is a realistic review timeline? Are there any anticipated concerns or standard redline items?
Client feedback received in writing. All requested changes are documented and prioritized.

column3: Provider reviews & responds to client feedback
column11: Provider response to each item of feedback delivered. Open items logged with proposed resolutions.
Revised SOW version produced incorporating agreed-upon changes. Version-controlled and logged.
Client legal team engaged and reviewing final document. Point of contact confirmed.
Provider legal team engaged. Internal review underway.
All redlines and markup received from both parties. Negotiation underway.
All contract terms agreed upon. No outstanding redlines. Both parties confirm readiness to execute. *** KEY FORECAST MILESTONE ***
Final executed version of contract sent to authorized signatory at client. Docusign (or equivalent) initiated.
Fully executed agreement received. Deal marked Closed Won in CRM. Revenue recognition triggered. Ops team notified. *** CLOSE DATE — PRIMARY FORECAST MILESTONE ***
Delivery team formally assigned to account. Roles and responsibilities confirmed.
Team availability confirmed. Project schedule drafted. Start date locked.
Sales-to-delivery handoff complete. All context, client background, commitments, and sensitivities transferred to delivery team.
All internal systems configured. Project workspace ready. Any client-facing tools or access requests initiated.
Kickoff complete. Roles, responsibilities, communication cadence, and project schedule confirmed with client. *** KEY FORECAST MILESTONE ***
Onboarding tasks initiated. Client team actively engaged. Success metrics and check-in cadence established.

column1: === INTERNAL FORECAST SUMMARY — NOT FOR CLIENT DISTRIBUTION ===

column9: Indicates active evaluation. Both parties engaged.
Strong buying signal. Map client's internal process to protect timeline.
Late stage. Monitor client review timeline closely. Flag any procurement involvement.
Legal aligned. Close is imminent. Confirm signatory availability.
PRIMARY CLOSE DATE. Triggers revenue recognition, staffing activation, and project setup.
Revenue delivery has commenced. Account transitions to delivery team ownership.

column1: 1. Weighted Forecast Value = Deal Value × Probability %. Update Deal Value cell above and reference it in each row for a live weighted pipeline view.
2. Days to Close = Target Close Date (Step 24) minus today's date. Use a formula: =Step24TargetDate - TODAY()
3. At-Risk Flags: If any Forecast Milestone moves more than 7 days from its original target date, flag to AE and Ops leadership immediately.
4. Client-Facing Version: When sharing this MAP with the client, filter to rows where Client-Facing = Y. Hide the Forecast Milestone column and the entire Forecast Summary section.
